been

form.

ancient
 
Greece,

modern
 
mathematics,
 
architecture,
 
and
 
even
 
art.

,

and
 
circles

building

of
 
physical
 
space.

to
 
comprehend,

in
 
structure,
 
and
 
highly
 
effective

and
 
ordered
 
world
 
we
 
typically
 
experience.
 
However,  the  universe  is  far  more  complex  and  far-reaching  than  the  straight  lines  and  rigid  
angles
 
that
 
classical
 
geometry
 
describes.

natural
 
world

not

strictly
 
to
 
flat,
 
simple
 
geometries.

text:
The  concept  of  fractals  was  first  formalized  in  the  late  20th  century  by  mathematician  Benoît  B.  
Mandelbrot
,
 
who
 
coined
 
the
 
term
 
"fractal"
 
to
 
describe
 
shapes
 
that
 
were
 
self-similar
 
and
 
exhibited
 
infinite
 
complexity.
 
Unlike
 
the
 
shapes
 
defined
 
by
 
classical
 
geometry
,
 
such
 
as
 
circles
 
and
 
polygons
,
 
which
 
have
 
well-defined
 
edges
 
and
 
dimensions,
 
fractals
 
have
 
a
 
fractional
 
dimension
 
and
 
are
 
more
 
akin
 
to
 
the
 
irregular,
 
organic
 
forms
 
we
 
see
 
in

larger,
 
more

fractal
 
geometry
.

evidence
 
across

domains

have

doors

new
 
ways

thinking
 
and
 
creating.
 
In
 
this
 
section,

will

diverse

thinking
 
in
 
understanding
 
the
 
world
 
around
 
us.

of
 
the
 
brain
,
 
from
 
galaxies
 
to
 
clouds
.
